channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2023081109
item.description:
Report X-2023081109

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T03:11:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was placed inside trailer with arrows not pointing up and when unloaded manager picked up contents spilled on her DescribePack: the cap had come loose and leaked when not placed upright DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed with arrows pointing up in hazbag lined tote

item.title: Report X-2023080880
item.description:
Report X-2023080880

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: SAINT PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: found in cage, handle was missing and the contents were leaking into the containment tote DescribePack: plastic can was gouged and missing components, leaking from the lid and the bottom of the bucket DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: bucket was placed in a lined hazmat tote with absorbent pads.

item.title: Report X-2023080836
item.description:
Report X-2023080836

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING ON OUR LOADING DOCK. IT WAS IN AN UNMARKED BOX THAT HAD BEEN REPACKED BY ANOTHER STATION WHO FAILED TO ADD ANY UP ARROWS OR DIAMOND LABELS ONTO THE PACKAGE. THEY DID TAPE THE OP-900 TO THE PACKAGE. THE ADMIN PLACED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED TOTE AND BROUGH IT TO THE HAZ CAGE FOR INSPECTION. THEY ALSO FAILED TO RELABEL THE PACKAGE THEY JUST REPACKED IT INTO AN UNMARKED BOX AND TRIED TO SEND IT FORWARD. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS WAY TO BIG FOR JUST THE THREE ITEMS THAT WERE LOOSE INSIDE OF IT. NORMALLY THESE PACKAGES CONTAIN FOUR BOTTLES NOT JUST THREE. WHICH LEADS ME TO BELIEVE SINCE IT WAS REPACKED IF THE MISSING BOTTLE MAY OF BEEN DAMAGED. ONE OF THE ITEMS INSIDE THE PACKAGE DID OPEN FROM THE LID CAUSING IT TO SPILL OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED ITEM WAS PLACED INSIDE A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING. THE LAST TWO UNDAMGED ITEMS HAVE BEEN PROPERLY REPACKED SO THEY MAY BE RTS.
